value.name: British lawmakers pass PM's Rwanda bill
value.description: Keir Starmer, leader of the main opposition Labour Party, said earlier Wednesday that Sunak has been "brutally exposed by his own MPs yet again" and called the government's plan "a farce." The British government said that it has given Rwanda 240 million ...

value.name: Times letters: Obesity crisis and fears about the nanny state
value.description: Sir, As far as childhood obesity goes, Alice Thomson is right to believe that voters may welcome a little nannying (“Starmer right to assert his inner Mary Poppins”, Jan 17). For the past 30 years

value.name: Sunak Defends Rwanda Plan At PMQS As Starmer Goes On The Offensive Ahead Of Crucial Vote
value.description: Two deputy chairmen of the Conservatives resigned from their roles as they joined dozens of Tory right-wingers in backing amendments to toughen the scheme.

value.name: DAILY MAIL COMMENT: At 11th hour, Tories see sense on Rwanda
value.description: After a nail-biting day of cajoling, reassuring, phone-calling, arm-twisting and - let's not be coy - threats by the whips, Tory MPs backed Rishi Sunak's flagship Rwanda migrant plan.

value.name: How Rishi Sunak beat the Tory right with Priti Patel's deal, Starmer's PMQs and MP 'wimps'
value.description: ANALYSIS: Rishi Sunak has won a major victory and defeated the right of his party meaning he now will almost certainly lead the Tories into the next election.

value.name: Sir Tony Lloyd, Labour MP for Rochdale, dies at 73
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer, the Labour leader, said that Lloyd’s death was a “terrible loss”, writing on Twitter/X: “We will remember his deep commitment to Labour values and his decency.”

value.name: Sunak survives as Rwanda rebellion melts away
value.description: Labour has accused Rishi Sunak of being “in office but not in power,” after the Prime Minister saw off a rebellion over his flagship Rwanda plan.

value.name: Conservatives release Better Call Saul-themed Keir Starmer attack advert
value.description: Sir Keir came under fire on Wednesday for once acting on behalf of Hizb ut-Tahrir, an Islamist extremist group

value.name: Sunak Says UK Is Ready To Strike Houthis Rebels Once More
value.description: Rishi Sunak contradicts Grant Shapps as he warns that the UK is ready to strike Yemeni rebels once more if the group continue to hold hostages and attack shipments.

value.name: Rishi Sunak wins Rwanda bill vote after facing down rebels
value.description: The Safety of Rwanda (Asylum and Immigration) Bill passed its third reading Wednesday evening with 320 MPs voting in support, and 276 voting against, giving the government a comfortable majority of 44. Only 11 Conservative MPs voted against the bill, including former Home Secretary Suella Braverman and former immigration minister Robert Jenrick.

value.name: Rwanda plan: What’s next after Sunak wins vote?
value.description: Rishi Sunak’s flagship Rwanda plan has passed a key vote amongst MPs by 320 votes to 276. Enough MPs backed the government's key Safety of Rwanda Bill, meaning a touted rebellion by a group of Conservative MPs failed to materialise.

value.name: Rwanda deportation bill passes as Tory rebellion collapses
value.description: The Rwanda Bill has passed through the House of Commons after a Tory rebellion over the policy collapsed, in a significant victory for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak. MPs on the right of the party had sought compromises from Downing Street over the legislation, only to buckle when it came to the vote.

value.name: Sunak has won the immigration battle but he’s losing the election war
value.description: Rishi Sunak has won an important victory in the House of Commons. But he is losing the battle that really matters – for the hearts and minds of the public. It is without doubt a victory for the Prime Minister to have pushed his Safety of Rwanda Bill through the Commons, although he faces a real fight to get it through the Lords.

mentions.name: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

value.name: Parliament to hold a minute's silence in memory of Rochdale MP Sir Tony Lloyd
value.description: MPs will hold a minute's silence on Thursday (January 18) in memory of Tony Lloyd following his death aged 73. The Rochdale MP died 'peacefully' and 'surrounded' by his loved ones on Wednesday morning, his family announced.

value.name: Rwanda Bill passes as only 11 Tory MPs rebel
value.description: Brendan Clarke-Smith, who won the Red Wall seat of Bassetlaw at the last general election, left his position on Tuesday to support amendments aimed at toughening the Prime Minister’s proposals, including one that would direct British courts to ignore ECHR rulings in specific cases.

value.name: Rwanda president: efforts to implement asylum plan cannot ‘drag on’
value.description: Paul Kagame also says he would be happy for the scheme to be scrapped

value.description: It is understood the talks about a potential change of government after the election could start before the end of January.

value.name: Labour request talks with civil service in preparation for No 10
value.description: Keir Starmer writes cabinet secretary, to begin so-called access talks ahead of possible election victory Labour has formally requested talks with the civil service in preparation for government if the party wins the election, with discussions expected to ...

value.name: Keir Starmer slammed over new Gaza ceasefire U-turn
value.description: KEIR Starmer has been slammed over another policy U-turn – after appearing to shift his stance on a ceasefire in Gaza.

value.name: Tories pray for electoral salvation. Will St Boris intercede?
value.description: Remember, the public doesn’t trust the Conservatives on immigration, and the infighting this week (plus Keir Starmer’s jibes) have only further eroded the government’s authority.

value.name: York MP's seat would change hands if general election was 'tomorrow', survey says

value.description: While infrastructure and other spending seems big by European standards – and is a far more ambitious package than that offered by Keir Starmer in Britain – it meant only a modest improvement for most working people and going backwards for others.

value.description: Rishi Sunak's flagship legislation was given its third reading by MPs after rebels stopped short of inflicting a defeat that could potentially have collapsed the government.

value.name: Live news: US court lifts stay on Apple Watch sales ban
value.description: A US appeals court has lifted its stay on a sales ban on two editions of the Apple Watch, creating another hurdle in the tech giant’s legal dispute with health technology company Masimo over patents for its blood oxygen tracking function. The dollar hit a one-month high as traders slashed expectations for a March interest rate cut in the US.

value.name: Tributes paid to former shadow NI Secretary Tony Lloyd following death
value.description: Former shadow Secretary of State for the north Tony Lloyd will be remembered for his “strong affinity and connection with Ireland” following his death at the age of 73. The Labour MP for Rochdale died on Wednesday morning, his family confirmed.

value.name: Veteran Labour MP Sir Tony Lloyd has died
value.description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer paid tribute to the veteran politician’s “desire to make the world a better, fairer place” and called his passing a “terrible loss”. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said his thoughts were with Sir Tony’s family, ...

value.name: Rishi rattled by Rwanda ridicule
value.description: The PM suffered a multiple motorway pile-up of ridicule in PMQs as Keir Starmer repeatedly asked an unanswerable question

value.name: Rwandan president Paul Kagame suggests UK could get money back
value.description: Rwanda's President Paul Kagame has said he could return money to the UK if no asylum seekers are sent to his country under his deal with the government. The UK has paid £240m to Rwanda, with a further £50m to come. So far, no asylum seekers have been sent to the country.

value.name: Tories defend 'Better Call Keir' attack ad that seeks to highlight Labour leader's legal past

value.name: ‘Having bad teeth nearly killed me’
value.description: As Keir Starmer calls for supervised brushing in schools, one man describes how a routine appointment lead to a near-fatal heart condition ‘I wish I'd known then about the correlation between the teeth and the heart, and had looked after them better’ I ...

value.name: A red in every sense, Sir Tony Lloyd was a pillar of Greater Manchester politics - and a staunch campaigner for justice for its citizens
value.description: Sir Tony Lloyd, who has died aged 73, was quietly spoken, always sharply dressed and had a long political career. He was the first - albeit interim - Greater Manchester mayor in 2015, a post he held for two years. The roots of his political passion lay in the Spanish Civil War of the 1930s.

value.name: Rwanda: No10 urges Tories to 'get behind this Bill' ahead of crunch vote
value.description: MPs are currently debating Rishi Sunak's Rwanda plan ahead of a crucial vote on Wednesday evening | ITV National News

value.name: Tories Mocked For 'Better Call Keir' Attack On Starmer
value.description: The Conservative Party has faced ridicule after likening Keir Starmer to Bob Odenkirk’s character in the hit US TV show Better Call Saul. Highlighting the Labour leader’s time as a criminal defence barrister is gearing up to be one of the Tory election attack lines in the run-up to this year’s vote.

value.name: Keir Starmer slammed over new Gaza ceasefire U-turn
value.description: KEIR Starmer has been slammed over another policy U-turn – after appearing to shift his stance on a ceasefire in Gaza.

value.name: Rishi Sunak on course to WIN crunch Rwanda vote as Tory rebellion fizzles out
value.description: RISHI Sunak looks set to WIN tonight’s make-or-break Rwanda vote after a Tory revolt fizzled out. Most of the rightwingers threatening to oppose the PM have reluctantly agreed to back him

value.name: Refugees victims of Tory infighting
value.description: One Tory, Giles Watling, even proposed an armed invasion of northern France to block refugees seeking to cross the Channel. “This is a defence of the realm matter and we need British boots on the ground,” he told MPs.

value.name: Veteran Labour MP Sir Tony Lloyd dies aged 73 after leukaemia battle
value.description: Rochdale MP Sir Tony Lloyd died peacefully at home after leaving hospital last week to spend time with his family when doctors said his illness had become untreatable

value.name: Politics live: Braverman joins rebel warnings to Sunak ahead of defining night for Rwanda plan
value.description: It comes after the prime minister was told off during a feisty exchange with Sir Keir Starmer at PMQs. Rwanda treaty does not make country safe for asylum seekers, peers warn Rishi Sunak's Rwanda treaty does not make it a safe country to send asylum ...

value.name: Bruised Sunak Survives Key Vote on His UK Immigration Policy
value.description: Rishi Sunak’s signature plan to deport asylum-seekers survived a key vote in Parliament, but not before the British prime minister suffered a series of blows to his authority that damaged his hopes of avoiding defeat at a general election later this year.

value.name: King Charles to attend hospital for prostate treatment
value.description: The King will go to hospital next week where he will be treated for an enlarged prostate. The 75-year-old monarch's condition is benign but his public engagements will be postponed while he recuperates after the corrective procedure in a few days, Buckingham Palace has announced.

value.name: Labour should revive its inspired Sure Start scheme
value.description: Letters: Dr Sebastian Kraemer praises the children’s centres that provided for the poorest preschool children. Plus letters from John Anderson, Janet Lail, Gabrielle Palmer and a group of charities

He was the first - albeit interim - Greater Manchester mayor in 2015, a post he held for two years. The roots of his political passion lay in the Spanish Civil War of the 1930s.

value.name: Rwanda: No10 urges Tories to 'get behind this Bill' ahead of crunch vote
value.description: MPs are currently debating Rishi Sunak's Rwanda plan ahead of a crucial vote on Wednesday evening | ITV National News

value.name: Tories Mocked For 'Better Call Keir' Attack On Starmer
value.description: The Conservative Party has faced ridicule after likening Keir Starmer to Bob Odenkirk’s character in the hit US TV show Better Call Saul. Highlighting the Labour leader’s time as a criminal defence barrister is gearing up to be one of the Tory election attack lines in the run-up to this year’s vote.

value.name: Keir Starmer slammed over new Gaza ceasefire U-turn
value.description: KEIR Starmer has been slammed over another policy U-turn – after appearing to shift his stance on a ceasefire in Gaza.

value.name: Rishi Sunak on course to WIN crunch Rwanda vote as Tory rebellion fizzles out
value.description: RISHI Sunak looks set to WIN tonight’s make-or-break Rwanda vote after a Tory revolt fizzled out. Most of the rightwingers threatening to oppose the PM have reluctantly agreed to back him

value.name: Refugees victims of Tory infighting
value.description: One Tory, Giles Watling, even proposed an armed invasion of northern France to block refugees seeking to cross the Channel. “This is a defence of the realm matter and we need British boots on the ground,” he told MPs.

value.name: Veteran Labour MP Sir Tony Lloyd dies aged 73 after leukaemia battle
value.description: Rochdale MP Sir Tony Lloyd died peacefully at home after leaving hospital last week to spend time with his family when doctors said his illness had become untreatable

value.name: Politics live: Braverman joins rebel warnings to Sunak ahead of defining night for Rwanda plan
value.description: It comes after the prime minister was told off during a feisty exchange with Sir Keir Starmer at PMQs. Rwanda treaty does not make country safe for asylum seekers, peers warn Rishi Sunak's Rwanda treaty does not make it a safe country to send asylum ...

value.name: Bruised Sunak Survives Key Vote on His UK Immigration Policy
value.description: Rishi Sunak’s signature plan to deport asylum-seekers survived a key vote in Parliament, but not before the British prime minister suffered a series of blows to his authority that damaged his hopes of avoiding defeat at a general election later this year.

value.name: King Charles to attend hospital for prostate treatment
value.description: The King will go to hospital next week where he will be treated for an enlarged prostate. The 75-year-old monarch's condition is benign but his public engagements will be postponed while he recuperates after the corrective procedure in a few days, Buckingham Palace has announced.

value.name: Labour should revive its inspired Sure Start scheme
value.description: Letters: Dr Sebastian Kraemer praises the children’s centres that provided for the poorest preschool children. Plus letters from John Anderson, Janet Lail, Gabrielle Palmer and a group of charities

value.name: Sir Tony Lloyd: Veteran Labour MP for Rochdale dies aged 73
value.description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer said: "The death of Sir Tony Lloyd today is a terrible loss. I know the entire Labour Party, and many beyond the party, join me in sending our deepest condolences to Tony's wife, Judith, his children, Siobhan, Angharad ...

value.name: PMQs verdict: Keir Starmer can’t lose as long as the Rwanda plan looms
value.description: The opinions in Politics.co.uk's Comment section are those of the author. Keir Starmer, sensing an opening, continued. In fact, he asked the prime minister to detail the whereabouts of “lost” asylum seekers a further two times before he arrived at his ...

value.name: Labour defends Starmer’s legal advice to Hizb ut-Tahrir after Tory attack
value.description: Labour has defended Sir Keir Starmer’s decision to advise the soon-to-be-banned Islamist group Hizb ut-Tahrir during his legal career after Rishi Sunak used the case as an attack line against the Opposition leader. It is a “fundamental principle” of ...

value.name: 'When I Stand Up, You Sit Down': Commons Speaker Brutally Slaps Down Rishi Sunak
value.description: Rishi Sunak was slapped down by the Commons Speaker on Wednesday after he brandished a “prop” attacking Keir Starmer during PMQs. Lindsay Hoyle told the PM: “When I stand up, please sit down.” The clash came during feisty exchanges between Sunak ...

value.name: Veteran Labour MP Sir Tony Lloyd dies at the age of 73
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer was among those paying tribute. The Labour leader said: "The death of Sir Tony Lloyd today is a terrible loss. "We will remember his deep commitment to Labour values and his decency. "May he rest in peace." Sir Tony first entered ...

value.name: Tories pray for electoral salvation. Will St Boris intercede?
value.description: Remember, the public doesn’t trust the Conservatives on immigration, and the infighting this week (plus Keir Starmer’s jibes) have only further eroded the government’s authority.

value.name: Labour MP Sir Tony Lloyd dies days after announcing terminal cancer diagnosis
value.description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer paid tribute to the veteran politician’s “desire to make the world a better, fairer place” and called his passing a “terrible loss”. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said his thoughts were ...

value.name: No one does polarisation like Trump
value.description: While infrastructure and other spending seems big by European standards – and is a far more ambitious package than that offered by Keir Starmer in Britain – it meant only a modest improvement for most working people and going backwards for others.

value.name: Veteran Labour MP Tony Lloyd dies aged 73 after blood cancer battle

about.name: Tumors of the hematopoietic and lymphoid tissues

value.name: Poll: Two Bradford Tory MPs would lose if election was today
value.description: The results of the model, which uses data from 14,110 respondents answering between December 12, 2023, and January 4, 2024, would see Keir Starmer enter Downing Street having secured a 120-seat majority, with Labour winning 385 Commons seats. This would be ...
